net.adamcin.oakpal.core

Class CheckSpec

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.adamcin.oakpal.core.CheckSpec
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JsonObjectConvertible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CheckSpec.ImmutableSpec

    @ProviderType
public class CheckSpec
extends Object
implements JsonObjectConvertible
    DTO for full-featured check spec.

        public CheckSpec()

    • Method Detail

      • keys

        @NotNull
public static CheckSpec.JsonKeys keys()

      • getImpl

        public String getImpl()
        The direct classpath lookup name for a particular check. If not provided, indicates that a check should be looked up by name from a catalog on the classpath.
        Returns:
        className or script resource name of a ProgressCheck or ProgressCheckFactory.

      • setImpl

        public void setImpl(String impl)
        Set a new impl value. This is considered unspecified if the value is null or empty.
        Parameters:
        impl - the new value

      • getInlineScript

        public String getInlineScript()
        As an alternative to getImpl(), a CheckSpec may specify script check source code inline, i.e., as a javascript string. This pattern can make checklists more portable, at the expense of readability. This overrides getImpl() if this returns non-null.
        Returns:
        a string, invokable as a script, or null, if this field is unspecified.
        See Also:
        getInlineEngine()

      • setInlineScript

        public void setInlineScript(String inlineScript)
        Set a new invokable script check source value. If this is not invokable using the "javascript" engine, be sure to specify the engine name using setInlineEngine(String).
        Parameters:
        inlineScript - the new value, or null if unspecified
        See Also:
        getInlineEngine()

      • getInlineEngine

        public String getInlineEngine()
        Specifies a ScriptEngineFactory name, or null to use the default of "javascript", in conjunction with a non-null value for getInlineScript().
        Returns:
        a specific ScriptEngineFactory name or null to use "javascript"
        See Also:
        getInlineScript()

      • setInlineEngine

        public void setInlineEngine(String inlineEngine)
        Set a new ScriptEngineFactory name, or null for the default.
        Parameters:
        inlineEngine - the new value
        See Also:
        setInlineScript(String)

      • isAbstract

        public final boolean isAbstract()
        An abstract check spec has neither a non-empty getImpl() nor a non-null getInlineScript(), and is therefore not invokable on its own. It must overlay another check spec specified in a checklist by matching its name exactly, or matching this name as a suffix of the other the name.
        Returns:
        true if this check spec fails to specify getImpl() or getInlineScript()

      • notAbstract

        public final boolean notAbstract()
        Inverse of isAbstract(). Filter for selecting specs that DO have impl or inline attributes.
        Returns:
        true if has implementation

      • getName

        public String getName()
        The display name for the check. If "impl" is provided, and represents a script package check or a class that implements ProgressCheck or ProgressCheckFactory this is treated as an alias for the check during this execution.

        If "impl" is not provided, this is used to lookup a checklist check to overlay.

        If "impl" is not resolved to a progress check of some kind, this value is otherwise ignored.

        Returns:
        the checkName

      • setName

        public void setName(String name)
        Set a new display name for the check.
        Parameters:
        name - the new value

      • getTemplate

        public String getTemplate()
        If specified, inherit the getConfig() and either the getImpl() or getInlineScript() and getInlineEngine() of another CheckSpec, following the same rules of name matching that apply to getName().
        Returns:
        the checkName to inherit from

      • setTemplate

        public void setTemplate(String template)
        Set a new template value.
        Parameters:
        template - the new value

      • isSkip

        public boolean isSkip()
        Whether to skip this check during a scan. Only useful to set in a parameterized context or as an override for a checklist spec.
        Returns:
        skip

      • setSkip

        public void setSkip(boolean skip)
        Set to true to skip the check.
        Parameters:
        skip - the new value

      • notSkipped

        public final boolean notSkipped()
        The inverse of isSkip().
        Returns:
        true if not skipped

      • getConfig

        public javax.json.JsonObject getConfig()
        If impl references a script check or a ProgressCheckFactory, or if the check loaded from a checklist by name is a script check or a ProgressCheckFactory, this is used to configure the check.
        Returns:
        the JsonObject configuration for the package check

      • setConfig

        public void setConfig(javax.json.JsonObject config)
        Set a new config object value.
        Parameters:
        config - the new value

      • overrides

        public final boolean overrides(@NotNull
                               @NotNull CheckSpec that)
        Returns true if this overrides that.

        1. Neither this spec nor that spec have a template specified (use inherit(CheckSpec) in that case) 2. Neither this spec nor that spec are unnamed (unnamed specs cannot be overridden). 3a. This name matches that name exactly (explicit override allowing different impl), OR 3b. This is abstract and that name ENDS with "/" + this name (implicit override for skipping or merging config)

        Parameters:
        that - the other spec
        Returns:
        true if this overrides that

      • isOverriddenBy

        public final boolean isOverriddenBy(@NotNull
                                    @NotNull CheckSpec that)
        The inverse of overrides(CheckSpec).
        Parameters:
        that - the other spec
        Returns:
        true if this is overridden by that

      • overlay

        public final CheckSpec overlay(@NotNull
                               @NotNull CheckSpec that)
        Apply this spec's attributes as an overlay to that spec's attributes. Recommend checking for a true from overrides(CheckSpec). If either this spec or that spec specify "skip=true", the composite spec will be skipped.
        Parameters:
        that - the other spec to override
        Returns:
        a new composite spec
        See Also:
        overrides(CheckSpec)

      • inherits

        public final boolean inherits(@NotNull
                              @NotNull CheckSpec that)
        Return true if this spec identifies that spec by name in this spec's template attribute.
        Parameters:
        that - the other spec
        Returns:
        true if this inherits from that

      • isInheritedBy

        public final boolean isInheritedBy(@NotNull
                                   @NotNull CheckSpec that)
        The inverse of inherits(CheckSpec).
        Parameters:
        that - the other check spec
        Returns:
        true if this is inherited by that

      • inherit

        public final CheckSpec inherit(@NotNull
                               @NotNull CheckSpec that)
        Apply this spec's attributes to that as an overlay to that spec's attributes. Recommend checking for a true from inherits(CheckSpec). This spec's name and skip attributes takes precedence over that's.
        Parameters:
        that - the other spec to inherit from
        Returns:
        the composite check spec
